blog.name: asoiafuniversity
blog.title: ASOIAF University
blog.description:
A collection of metas (critical essays or analysis), gathered from across tumblr, about George R.R. Martin's book series A Song of Ice and Fire (ASOIAF) and its television adaptation Game of Thrones.

For more information about this blog, please read our FAQ.

summary: The King Under the Mountain Archetype in ASOIAF
title: The King Under the Mountain Archetype in ASOIAF
description:
@mightyisobel submitted:

The King Under the Mountain is a worldwide archetype that stretches as far into history as memory, and is a powerful archetype George R. R. Martin is using in his A Song of Ice and Fire series to deepen the mystery surrounding certain characters he has created. In this essay, I hope to demonstrate that GRRM has loosely based Bran,Sam, and the Kings in the North on this archetype, analyze how Martin is using elements of the archetype to inform his work, and perhaps even make some predictions about what we can expect from these King Under the Mountain characters, and I’d love you to join me as we explore just how he does it…..

Keep reading

title: Another Dawn - fairytalelovr, toaquiprashippar - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 4/?
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Not Rated
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen, Robb Stark/Margaery Tyrell, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Catelyn Stark/Ned Stark, past Lyanna Stark/Rhaegar Targaryen
Characters: Jon Snow, Daenerys Targaryen, Ned Stark, Robb Stark, Arya Stark, Sansa Stark, Brandon Stark, Rickon Stark, Brynden “Bloodraven” Rivers, Jaime Lannister, Cersei Lannister, Robert Baratheon, Olenna Tyrell, Margaery Tyrell, Willas Tyrell, Loras Tyrell, Garlan Tyrell, Samwell Tarly, Tywin Lannister
Additional Tags: Fix-It, R plus L equals J, Jon Snow is a Targaryen, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, Angst, Humor, Fluff, Eventual Smut
Summary:

When everything seems lost and the Others are about to triumph, Bran comes up with a way to try for a second chance. Now he is back in Winterfell, before the Seven Kingdoms descended into chaos, and he must take the steps to ensure their survival. But how to convince everyone?
What of those who remember? Will they make the same mistakes all over again?

summary: What do you think is Arya's endgame? She gets a significant amount of pagetime, but unlike say Jon, Bran or Sansa I find it...
question: What do you think is Arya's endgame? She gets a significant amount of pagetime, but unlike say Jon, Bran or Sansa I find it really hard to gauge where her arc is going. What use is an assassin in the war against the Others (and she seems headed away from the revenge path anyway)? Heading Nynerias Wolfpack seems too obvious and renders her training as a faceless woman superflous. I'd love to hear your thoughts.
answer:
I’m not sure what Arya will end up doing exactly (especially during the new War for the Dawn), but I’m pretty sure of how she’ll fit into the springtime Starkling dynamic. 

Bran’s strengths are magical - what he’ll accomplish in his lifetime will help people for centuries, if not millennia. Sansa’s strengths are political - what she’ll accomplish will improve lives over years and decades. Arya’s strengths, though, they’re the strengths best suited to making a difference in the moment. Arya will be the Stark to go to for quick, effective fact-finding and justice on the spot.
